text: Upalite (Al(UO2)3(PO4)2O(OH)·7H2O) is a mineral found in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It is named after uranium, phosphorus and aluminium. Its type locality is Kobokobo pegmatite, Mwenga, Sud-Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo.Webmineral.com - UpaliteHandbook of Mineralogy (HOM - MSA) - Upalite == References == Category:Aluminium minerals Category:Uranium(VI) minerals Category:Phosphate minerals Category:Monoclinic minerals
title: Upalite
